definition: Li (c. 2000 BC), sixth of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God, also known as Ai 哀[Ai1]
"cliff" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 27), occurring in 原, 历, 压 etc

li, ancient measure of length, approx. 500 m/neighborhood/ancient administrative unit of 25 families/(Tw) borough, administrative unit between the township 鎮|镇[zhen4] and neighborhood 鄰|邻[lin2] levels
a form of transit taxation in China introduced to finance armies to suppress the Taiping Rebellion
not to deviate an iota (idiom)/to be extremely accurate
a tiny lapse can lead to a huge mistake (idiom); a minor discrepancy leading to enormous losses
